subject: Philosophy
title: What Is an Argument?
description: A short lesson to help you apply What Is an Argument?.

hook.text: In philosophy, an argument isn't a fight. It's a set of reasons designed to prove a conclusion.

buildup.text: Every argument has premises (starting claims) and a conclusion (what the premises are meant to prove).

discovery.text: A good argument is one where the premises actually support the conclusion â€” logically, not just emotionally.

twist.text: Most everyday 'arguments' are just assertions. Real arguments require structure and evidence.

climax.text: Learning to spot the difference between strong and weak arguments is the foundation of critical thinking.

punchline.text: An argument without structure is just an opinion.

quiz.question: What are the two essential parts of a logical argument?
